name: Answer Questions
definition: This capability allows users to ask questions or provide prompts and receive responses from the Gaia Task Assistant. Input: user query as text. Output: a textual answer generated by the Gaia AI assistant.

name: Execute academic signal task
definition: Processes end-to-end academic signal tasks by accepting user instructions that specify a date and a research domain (e.g., artificial intelligence, machine learning, deep learning). This capability collects relevant academic information, interprets the underlying signals, provides recommendations, and generates a comprehensive report that summarizes findings and insights.

name: Conduct conversation
definition: This capability allows users to engage in a natural language conversation with an AI assistant. It accepts text-based queries or prompts as input and returns clear, helpful textual responses as output.

name: Optimize user prompt
definition: This capability refines a user-supplied prompt to improve clarity, precision, and overall effectiveness of the AI response. It accepts a text input representing the user prompt and returns an optimized version of that text.

name: Iterative prompt optimization
definition: This capability performs iterative improvements on an already optimized prompt based on specific feedback. It accepts a text input of the existing prompt along with feedback details and returns a refined prompt that better meets user requirements.

name: Filter and Recommend Papers
definition: This capability accepts a JSON input object containing a list of ArXiv IDs (provided under the key 'arxiv_ids'). It retrieves the complete metadata for each paper, applies intelligent filtering, sorting, and ranking based on predefined semantic criteria or user instructions, and produces a JSON list of recommended paper ArXiv IDs in order of recommendation. The output is limited to a maximum of 8 recommended papers.

name: Extract, Filter, and Recommend from Text
definition: This capability accepts a natural language text input that may include one or more ArXiv IDs. It automatically extracts all valid ArXiv IDs from the text, retrieves their complete metadata, applies intelligent filtering and ranking using internal logic, and produces a JSON list of the most recommended ArXiv IDs. The output list is ordered by recommendation priority and limited to a maximum of 8 recommended papers.

name: Analyze Papers by Arxiv IDs
definition: This capability accepts a JSON object containing a list of ArXiv paper IDs as input. It automatically retrieves the corresponding papers from ArXiv, performs deep content analysis and summarization, and outputs a JSON list where each element is a Markdown-formatted detailed report for the analyzed paper.

name: Extract and Analyze Arxiv Papers
definition: This capability accepts a text input that includes one or more ArXiv paper IDs. It automatically extracts valid ArXiv IDs from the text, retrieves the corresponding papers, performs comprehensive analysis and summarization, and outputs a JSON list where each item is a Markdown-formatted report for each paper.

name: Analyze Attached Paper PDFs
definition: This capability processes PDF files attached in a message. It accepts a command with attached PDFs, reads each attached paper file, performs deep content analysis and summarization, and produces a JSON list where each element is a Markdown-formatted analysis report for the respective paper.

name: Download Paper PDFs
definition: This capability accepts a JSON object with an 'arxiv_ids' field containing a list of ArXiv paper IDs. It downloads each paper's PDF file, encodes the content in Base64 format, and returns a JSON list where each element is the Base64 encoded string of the corresponding PDF file.

name: Search Arxiv Papers
definition: This capability accepts either natural language instructions or a structured JSON query to search the Arxiv database for academic papers. The input can be a string such as 'recent AI papers' or a JSON object representing the query. The output is a JSON-formatted string containing a list of paper metadata including titles, authors, abstracts, and other relevant details.

name: Analyze Research Papers
definition: This capability analyzes a set of research papers or academic literature to extract potential research ideas and directions. It accepts academic texts or references as input and produces a summary of key insights, including specific research ideas and possible directions for further exploration.

name: Identify Research Gaps
definition: This capability examines academic literature to identify unexplored or under-researched areas within a specific field. It accepts text input or references from academic papers and outputs a list of potential research gaps, highlighting opportunities for further investigation.

name: Search academic papers
definition: This capability allows users to search academic papers using natural language queries. It accepts a text input query (e.g., 'Find papers about transformer attention mechanisms') and returns a numbered list of up to 5 relevant papers. Each paper result includes the paper title, authors and publication year, source (such as arXiv or Semantic Scholar), a truncated abstract, and available URL/PDF links.

name: Review PDF Paper
definition: This capability reviews an academic paper provided as a PDF file. It accepts a PDF file input which should include a file name ending in .pdf and base64-encoded file bytes. The agent extracts the text and metadata, then generates a comprehensive review report including paper metadata, scores (1-10) for methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance, as well as a detailed analysis covering summary, strengths, weaknesses, and questions. The output is returned as a structured text message in markdown format.

name: Review Paper from URL
definition: This capability reviews an academic paper provided via a URL. It accepts a URL pointing to an academic paper (such as arXiv URLs), automatically downloads and caches the corresponding PDF, extracts text and metadata, and generates a comprehensive review report including detailed analysis and scoring in methodology, novelty, clarity, and significance. The output is returned as a structured text message.

name: Greeting and Help
definition: This capability handles user greetings and provides information about the agent's functionalities. It accepts text inputs such as greetings or questions about capabilities, and outputs an explanation of available functions, usage instructions, and detailed information on how to effectively use the agent's services.

name: Chat with assistant
definition: This capability allows the user to engage in a conversation using a natural language text interface. It accepts a text query input and returns a text-based response providing helpful information, explanations, or engaging in general discussion.

name: Browse the web
definition: This capability allows users to submit a query (such as a question or search request) to retrieve current web-based information. It accepts a text input representing the query and produces an answer or relevant details derived from browsing up-to-date web content.

name: Conduct Conversation
definition: Provides general-purpose conversational AI services. Accepts user queries, requests for explanations, or discussion topics as input, and returns detailed textual responses while maintaining multi-turn dialogue context.

name: Edit and Transform Text
definition: Performs structured text edits including find-and-replace, templating, and content transformations. Accepts text input along with transformation instructions, and returns the modified text as output.
